meanings.definition: Capable of being absorbed or taken in
meanings.sent1: The sponge was so sorbable that it soaked up all the spilled water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel is sorbable, making it perfect for cleaning up spills.
meanings.sent3: The sorbable sponge had a thirst for water like a desert after rain.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a sorbable sponge, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The sorbable nature of the fabric made it ideal for soaking up any liquid.

meanings.definition: Able to be soaked up or taken in by a substance
meanings.sent1: The soil was sorbable, allowing the plant roots to absorb water easily.
meanings.sent2: The sorbable nature of the cloth made it great for wiping spills.
meanings.sent3: The sorbable paper towel was like a thirsty camel in the desert.
meanings.sent4: His words were sorbable, sinking deep into her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sorbable sponge eagerly drank up the spilled juice.
